question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.A: The UN Security Council has 30 members.
options.B: The UN Security Council has 15 members.

answer.text: There are 15 members on the UN Security Council, which recommends action when there are international crises and threats to peace.

question: The Council of Europe has the power to make laws which are binding in member states.

answer.text: The Council of Europe has 47 member countries, including the UK, and is responsible for the protection and promotion of human rights in those countries. It has no power to make laws but draws up conventions and charters.
